ground_truth: The Sinister Man clicks his heels and bows quickly. Brody takes off his hat. The man turns and joins a Second Man. Brody and Sallah follow them. The Second Man overhears Sallah. He and his companion turn quickly. Sallah puts Brody's luggage down and glances at Brody. Sallah pats his clothing, searching for his papers. Sallah laughs and pulls out a newspaper. Brody looks confused. Sallah shows the newspaper to the Second Man. Sallah puts the newspaper in front of the Second Man's face, then punches him through the newspaper. Donovan leads Vogel out. The Nazi Guards follow. Once they are gone, Elsa turns to Indy. She runs her hand down the side of his face. Indy and Henry are still tied back-to-back, of course. Elsa bends to speak quietly into Indy's ear, which is near enough to Henry's ear. She smiles and kisses Indy passionately. Henry glances back and looks rather disappointed. Vogel appears to remind Elsa of her appointment. Elsa exits. Vogel stays behind for another moment. Vogel punches Indy in the jaw, a hard and vicious jab that snaps Indy's head around. Indy and Henry are pulling at the ropes with great urgency. Henry is able to wiggle his hand towards Indy's coat pocket. Indy squirms his body around towards Henry's hand. Henry's fingers open the lighter and ignite the flame. Henry yelps as the cigarette lighter burns his hand. He drops the lighter to the floor. Henry kicks at the lighter, trying to reach it, but cannot. The rug starts to burn. Finally, they turn their heads in the same direction. Indy struggles to free his hands. His foot kicks out and accidentally hits a metal grill that operates a Secret Door, where a Nazi Radioman wearing headphones sits at an elaborate panel of dials, switches, and meters, and a woman stands over a map plotting coordinates. Their backs are turned to Indy and Henry, inside the fireplace, still tied back-to-back. Indy's foot hits the grill again. Four Nazi Radiomen and the woman are still hard at work with controls and coordinates. Suddenly the woman looks up and spots Henry and Indy. She screams. Indy finally breaks free. All four Radiomen now have their guns drawn. They activate the lever and begin to rotate through the Secret Door. The Radiomen appear in the fireplace on the other side, but there is no sign of Indy and Henry. The Radiomen move cautiously toward the flame, shielding their faces with one hand, holding their guns with the other. They've hidden themselves up the chimney. And now they drop down, behind the Radiomen. One of the Radiomen grabs Indy by the neck. As they struggle, they fall against the rotating wall and disappear into the next room, leaving a frightened Henry behind.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: The Sinister Man taps his heels and bows swiftly. Brody removes his hat. The man swivels and joins a Second Man. Brody and Sallah trail them. The Second Man catches Sallah. He and his comrade rotate swiftly. Sallah places Brody's luggage down and peeks at Brody. Sallah pats his attire, searching for his documents. Sallah chuckles and extracts a publication. Brody appears perplexed. Sallah displays the publication to the Second Man. Sallah places the publication in front of the Second Man's face, then strikes him through the publication. Donovan guides Vogel out. The Nazi Guards proceed. Once they are absent, Elsa turns to Indy. She caresses his face with her hand. Indy and Henry remain tied back-to-back, naturally. Elsa leans to speak softly into Indy's ear, which is close enough to Henry's ear. She grins and kisses Indy fervently. Henry peeks back and appears rather displeased. Vogel emerges to remind Elsa of her engagement. Elsa departs. Vogel lingers for another instant. Vogel strikes Indy in the jaw, a hard and brutal jab that snaps Indy's head around. Indy and Henry are tugging at the ropes with great urgency. Henry is able to move his hand towards Indy's coat pocket. Indy wriggles his body towards Henry's hand. Henry's fingers open the lighter and kindle the flame. Henry cries as the cigarette lighter scorches his hand. He drops the lighter to the ground. Henry kicks at the lighter, attempting to reach it, but cannot. The rug begins to burn. Finally, they turn their heads in the same direction. Indy struggles to release his hands. His foot kicks out and inadvertently hits a metal grate that operates a Secret Door, where a Nazi Radioman wearing headphones sits at a complex panel of dials, switches, and gauges, and a woman stands over a map plotting coordinates. Their backs are turned to Indy and Henry, within the fireplace, still tied back-to-back. Indy's foot hits the grate again. Four Nazi Radiomen and the woman are still hard at work with controls and coordinates. Suddenly the woman looks up and spots Henry and Indy. She shrieks. Indy finally breaks free. All four Radiomen now have their weapons drawn. They activate the lever and begin to rotate through the Secret Door. The Radiomen appear in the fireplace on the opposite side, but there is no sign of Indy and Henry. The Radiomen advance cautiously toward the flame, shielding their faces with one hand, holding their firearms with the other. They've concealed themselves up the chimney. And now they descend, behind the Radiomen. One of the Radiomen seizes Indy by the neck. As they grapple, they stumble against the rotating wall and vanish into the next room, leaving a frightened Henry behind.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: The heels are clicked by the Sinister Man, and a quick bow is made by him. His hat is taken off by Brody. A turn is made by the man, and he joins a Second Man. They are followed by Brody and Sallah. Sallah is overheard by the Second Man. The two of them turn quickly. Brody's luggage is put down by Sallah, and Brody is glanced at by Sallah. His clothing is patted by Sallah, who searches for his papers. A laugh is let out by Sallah, who pulls out a newspaper. Confusion is seen on Brody's face. The newspaper is shown to the Second Man by Sallah. The newspaper is put in front of the Second Man's face by Sallah, then a punch is delivered through the newspaper by him. Vogel is led out by Donovan. The Nazi Guards follow them. Once they are gone, Indy is turned to by Elsa. The side of his face is stroked by her hand. Indy and Henry are, of course, tied back-to-back still. Quiet words are bent to speak into Indy's ear by Elsa, which is near enough to Henry's ear. A smile is given, and Indy is kissed passionately by her. A glance back is given by Henry, who looks rather disappointed. Elsa is reminded of her appointment by Vogel. An exit is made by Elsa. Another moment is taken by Vogel, who stays behind. A vicious jab is delivered to Indy’s jaw by Vogel, snapping Indy's head around. The ropes are pulled at with great urgency by Indy and Henry. Henry is able to wiggle his hand towards Indy's coat pocket. Indy squirms his body around towards Henry's hand. The lighter is opened and ignited by Henry’s fingers. A yelp is given by Henry as his hand is burned by the cigarette lighter. The lighter is dropped to the floor by him. A kick is given to the lighter by Henry, trying to reach it, but it cannot be reached. The rug begins to burn. Their heads are finally turned in the same direction. The hands of Indy are struggled to be freed by him. A kick is given out by his foot that accidentally hits a metal grill, which operates a Secret Door, where a Nazi Radioman wearing headphones sits at an elaborate panel of dials, switches, and meters, and a woman stands over a map plotting coordinates. The backs of Indy and Henry are turned to them, inside the fireplace, still tied back-to-back. The grill is hit again by Indy's foot. Hard work with controls and coordinates is being done by four Nazi Radiomen and the woman. Suddenly, Henry and Indy are spotted by the woman, who looks up and screams. Finally, Indy breaks free. The guns are drawn by all four Radiomen now. The lever is activated, and they begin to rotate through the Secret Door. The Radiomen appear in the fireplace on the other side, but Indy and Henry are not seen. Cautious movement is made by the Radiomen toward the flame, shielding their faces with one hand and holding their guns with the other. Indy and Henry have hidden themselves up the chimney. They now drop down, behind the Radiomen. Indy is grabbed by one of the Radiomen by the neck. As the struggle occurs, they fall against the rotating wall and disappear into the next room, leaving a frightened Henry behind.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: The Sinister Man clicks his heels and bows. Brody removes his hat. The man joins a Second Man, followed by Brody and Sallah. The Second Man overhears Sallah, and both men turn. Sallah sets down Brody's luggage, searches his clothing, and laughs, pulling out a newspaper. He shows it to the Second Man, then punches him through it. Donovan leads Vogel out, followed by Nazi Guards. Once gone, Elsa turns to Indy, caressing his face. Indy and Henry are tied back-to-back. Elsa whispers to Indy, smiles, and kisses him passionately. Henry looks disappointed. Vogel reminds Elsa of her appointment, and she exits. Vogel stays briefly, punching Indy hard in the jaw. Indy and Henry urgently pull at the ropes. Henry reaches Indy's coat pocket, ignites a lighter, yelps as it burns him, and drops it. The rug catches fire. Indy kicks a metal grill, operating a Secret Door, revealing a Nazi Radioman and a woman plotting coordinates. Indy's foot hits the grill again. The woman spots Henry and Indy and screams. Indy breaks free. Four Radiomen draw guns, activate a lever, and rotate through the Secret Door. They appear in the fireplace, but Indy and Henry are gone, hiding up the chimney. They drop down behind the Radiomen. One Radioman grabs Indy, and they struggle, falling against the rotating wall and disappearing into the next room, leaving Henry behind.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: The Sinister Man clicks his heels and bows. Brody removes his hat. The man joins a Second Man, followed by Brody and Sallah. The Second Man overhears Sallah, and both turn. Sallah puts down Brody's luggage, searches his clothing, laughs, and shows a newspaper to the Second Man, then punches him through it. Donovan leads Vogel out, followed by Nazi Guards. Elsa turns to Indy, runs her hand down his face, whispers in his ear, smiles, and kisses him. Henry looks disappointed. Vogel reminds Elsa of her appointment; she exits. Vogel punches Indy hard. Indy and Henry, tied back-to-back, urgently pull at the ropes. Henry reaches Indy's coat pocket, ignites a lighter, yelps, and drops it. The rug burns. Indy kicks a metal grill, revealing a Secret Door with a Nazi Radioman and a woman plotting coordinates. Indy's foot hits the grill again. The woman spots them and screams. Indy breaks free. Four Radiomen draw guns, activate a lever, and rotate through the Secret Door. The Radiomen appear in the fireplace, but Indy and Henry are gone, hiding up the chimney. They drop down behind the Radiomen. A Radioman grabs Indy, and they struggle, falling against the rotating wall, disappearing into the next room, leaving Henry behind.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: The Sinister Man, with a swift and precise motion, clicks his heels together and bows quickly in a formal manner. Observing this, Brody respectfully removes his hat. The Sinister Man then turns on his heel and joins a Second Man who is waiting nearby. Brody and Sallah, without hesitation, follow them closely. As they proceed, the Second Man catches a snippet of Sallah's conversation. He and his companion react immediately, turning around with quick movements. Sallah, meanwhile, sets Brody's luggage down gently and casts a glance at Brody. He begins to pat his clothing, searching diligently for his papers. With a laugh, Sallah triumphantly pulls out a newspaper instead. Brody, looking somewhat bewildered, watches as Sallah presents the newspaper to the Second Man. Sallah holds the newspaper up in front of the Second Man's face, then unexpectedly punches him through the paper. Meanwhile, Donovan takes the lead, guiding Vogel out of the scene. The Nazi Guards follow closely behind them. Once they have exited, Elsa turns her attention to Indy. She gently runs her hand down the side of his face, a tender gesture. Indy and Henry remain tied back-to-back, of course, unable to move freely. Elsa leans in, bending down to speak softly into Indy's ear, which is conveniently close to Henry's ear as well. She smiles warmly and kisses Indy with passionate intensity. Henry, glancing back, looks rather disappointed by the display. Vogel reappears to remind Elsa of her scheduled appointment. With a nod, Elsa exits the scene. Vogel lingers for a moment longer. He delivers a hard and vicious punch to Indy's jaw, snapping Indy's head around with the force of the blow. Indy and Henry, feeling the urgency of their situation, begin to pull at the ropes binding them. Henry manages to wiggle his hand towards Indy's coat pocket. Indy squirms his body around, trying to assist Henry's hand. Henry's fingers find the lighter, and he flicks it open, igniting the flame. However, Henry yelps in pain as the cigarette lighter burns his hand, causing him to drop it to the floor. Desperately, Henry kicks at the lighter, attempting to reach it, but he cannot. The rug beneath them starts to catch fire. Finally, they both turn their heads in the same direction, realizing the danger. Indy struggles with determination to free his hands. In the process, his foot accidentally kicks out and hits a metal grill that operates a Secret Door. Behind this door, a Nazi Radioman, wearing headphones, sits at an elaborate panel filled with dials, switches, and meters, while a woman stands over a map, plotting coordinates. Their backs are turned to Indy and Henry, who are still tied back-to-back inside the fireplace. Indy's foot hits the grill once more. The four Nazi Radiomen and the woman remain focused on their work with controls and coordinates. Suddenly, the woman looks up and spots Henry and Indy. She screams in alarm. Indy finally manages to break free from his bonds. All four Radiomen now have their guns drawn, ready for action. They activate the lever, causing the Secret Door to begin rotating. The Radiomen appear in the fireplace on the other side, but there is no sign of Indy and Henry. The Radiomen move cautiously toward the growing flame, shielding their faces with one hand while holding their guns with the other. Unbeknownst to them, Indy and Henry have cleverly hidden themselves up the chimney. At the opportune moment, they drop down behind the unsuspecting Radiomen. In the ensuing struggle, one of the Radiomen grabs Indy by the neck. As they grapple, they fall against the rotating wall, disappearing into the next room, leaving a frightened Henry behind to face the uncertainty alone.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: The Sinister Man, with an impressively swift and precise motion, clicks his heels together, and then, in a formal and polite manner, bows quickly. Observing this display of etiquette, Brody respectfully removes his hat as a sign of mutual respect. The Sinister Man then pivots on his heel and proceeds to join a Second Man who is waiting nearby with a composed demeanor. Without any hesitation or delay, Brody and Sallah decide to follow them closely. As they proceed along their path, the Second Man catches a snippet of Sallah's ongoing conversation. He and his companion react immediately, turning around with quick and decisive movements. Meanwhile, Sallah gently places Brody's luggage down and glances knowingly at Brody. He begins to pat his clothing, searching meticulously for his important papers. With a lighthearted laugh, Sallah triumphantly pulls out a newspaper instead. Looking somewhat bewildered, Brody watches the scene unfold as Sallah presents the newspaper to the Second Man. Sallah holds it up in front of the Second Man's face, then unexpectedly punches him through the paper, catching him off guard. Meanwhile, Donovan takes the lead and guides Vogel out of the scene, with the Nazi Guards closely trailing behind them. Once they have made their exit, Elsa turns her attention toward Indy, gently running her hand down the side of his face, making the gesture tender and affectionate. Indy and Henry remain tied back-to-back, unable to move freely. Elsa leans in, bending down to speak softly into Indy's ear, which conveniently is also close to Henry's ear. She smiles warmly and then kisses Indy with passionate intensity. Henry, glancing back, looks rather disappointed by the display of affection. Vogel reappears, reminding Elsa of her scheduled appointment. With a nod of acknowledgment, Elsa exits the scene. Vogel lingers for a moment longer, delivering a hard and vicious punch to Indy's jaw, the force of the blow snapping Indy's head around. Indy and Henry, sensing the urgency of their predicament, begin to pull at the ropes binding them. Henry manages to wiggle his hand toward Indy's coat pocket. Indy squirms his body around, trying to assist Henry's hand. Henry's fingers locate the lighter, and he flicks it open, igniting a small flame. However, Henry yelps in sudden pain as the cigarette lighter burns his hand, causing him to drop it to the floor. Desperately, Henry kicks at the lighter, attempting to reach it, but he is unable to do so. The rug beneath them starts to catch fire, posing an immediate threat. Finally, they both turn their heads in the same direction, realizing the imminent danger. Indy struggles with great determination to free his hands. In the process, his foot accidentally kicks out and hits a metal grill that operates a Secret Door mechanism. Behind this door, a Nazi Radioman, wearing large headphones, sits at an elaborate panel filled with various dials, switches, and meters, while a woman stands over a map, meticulously plotting coordinates. Their backs are turned to Indy and Henry, who remain tied back-to-back inside the fireplace. Indy's foot hits the grill once more. The four Nazi Radiomen and the woman remain focused on their tasks with controls and coordinates. Suddenly, the woman looks up and spots Henry and Indy, screaming in alarm. Indy finally manages to break free from his bonds. All four Radiomen now have their guns drawn, poised and ready for action. They activate the lever, causing the Secret Door to slowly begin rotating. The Radiomen appear in the fireplace on the other side, but there is no sign of Indy and Henry. The Radiomen move cautiously toward the growing flame, shielding their faces with one hand while holding their guns ready with the other. Unbeknownst to them, Indy and Henry have cleverly hidden themselves up the chimney. At the opportune moment, they drop down behind the unsuspecting Radiomen. In the ensuing struggle, one of the Radiomen grabs Indy by the neck. As they grapple fiercely, they fall against the rotating wall, disappearing into the next room, leaving a frightened Henry behind to face the uncertainty alone.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: The Sinister Man stands with a sharp click of his heels, executing a swift bow that conveys both respect and urgency. Brody, in response, reaches up to remove his hat, a gesture of acknowledgment. The Sinister Man then pivots on his heel, moving with purpose to join a Second Man who is waiting nearby. Observing this, Brody and Sallah decide to follow, trailing behind the two men. As they walk, the Second Man catches a snippet of Sallah's conversation, causing him and his companion to abruptly turn around, their attention now fully on Sallah. In response, Sallah carefully lowers Brody's luggage to the ground, casting a quick glance at Brody to gauge his reaction. He then begins to pat down his own clothing, searching for something important. With a chuckle, Sallah retrieves a newspaper from his pocket, holding it up for Brody to see, who looks on with a puzzled expression. Sallah then confidently presents the newspaper to the Second Man, holding it up to his face as if to show him something of interest. In a surprising twist, Sallah uses the newspaper as a cover to deliver a punch directly through it, catching the Second Man off guard. Meanwhile, Donovan takes the lead, guiding Vogel out of the scene, with the Nazi Guards trailing behind them. Once they have exited, Elsa turns her attention to Indy, her demeanor shifting to one of intimacy. She gently runs her hand down the side of Indy's face, a tender gesture that contrasts with the tension in the room. Indy and Henry remain tied back-to-back, their movements restricted. Elsa leans in, her lips close to Indy's ear, which is conveniently near Henry's ear as well, and whispers something softly. She then smiles, leaning in further to kiss Indy passionately, a display that leaves Henry glancing back with a look of disappointment. Just then, Vogel reappears, reminding Elsa of her impending appointment, prompting her to leave the room. Vogel lingers for a moment longer, taking the opportunity to deliver a brutal punch to Indy's jaw, a forceful blow that causes Indy's head to snap to the side. With urgency, Indy and Henry begin to pull at the ropes binding them, their movements frantic. Henry manages to maneuver his hand towards Indy's coat pocket, while Indy twists his body to assist Henry's reach. Henry's fingers find the lighter, flicking it open to ignite a small flame. However, the heat quickly becomes unbearable, and Henry yelps in pain, dropping the lighter to the floor. Desperate to retrieve it, Henry kicks at the lighter, but it remains out of reach. The rug beneath them begins to smolder, the flames licking at the edges. Realizing the danger, Indy and Henry turn their heads in unison, their focus now on freeing themselves. Indy's foot inadvertently strikes a metal grill, which operates a Secret Door. Behind this door, a Nazi Radioman, wearing headphones, is engrossed in an elaborate panel of dials, switches, and meters, while a woman stands over a map, plotting coordinates. Their backs are turned to Indy and Henry, who remain tied back-to-back inside the fireplace. Indy's foot hits the grill once more, drawing attention to their predicament. The four Nazi Radiomen and the woman continue their work, oblivious to the unfolding drama. Suddenly, the woman looks up, her eyes widening as she spots Henry and Indy. She lets out a scream, alerting the Radiomen, who immediately draw their guns. They activate a lever, causing the Secret Door to rotate, revealing the fireplace on the other side. However, Indy and Henry are nowhere to be seen. The Radiomen, guns at the ready, cautiously approach the flames, shielding their faces with one hand while maintaining their grip on their weapons with the other. Unbeknownst to them, Indy and Henry have hidden themselves up the chimney. Seizing the moment, they drop down behind the Radiomen, taking them by surprise. In the ensuing struggle, one of the Radiomen grabs Indy by the neck. As they grapple, they stumble against the rotating wall, disappearing into the next room and leaving a startled Henry behind.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: The Sinister Man clicks his heels, bows quickly, and then joins a Second Man, prompting Brody and Sallah to follow. When the Second Man overhears Sallah, he and his companion turn quickly. Sallah sets down Brody's luggage, searches his clothing, and, with a laugh, pulls out a newspaper to show the Second Man before using it to punch him. Meanwhile, Donovan leads Vogel out, followed by Nazi Guards. Once they leave, Elsa turns to Indy, caresses his face, whispers in his ear, and kisses him passionately, leaving Henry disappointed. Vogel returns to remind Elsa of her appointment, and after she exits, he viciously punches Indy. Tied back-to-back, Indy and Henry urgently work to free themselves. Henry reaches for Indy's coat pocket, ignites a lighter, but drops it, causing the rug to catch fire. As they struggle, Indy accidentally kicks a metal grill, revealing a Secret Door with Nazi Radiomen and a woman plotting coordinates. Indy's foot hits the grill again, alerting the woman, who screams. Indy breaks free, and as the Radiomen draw their guns, Indy and Henry rotate through the Secret Door, hiding up the chimney. They drop down behind the Radiomen, and in the ensuing struggle, Indy and a Radioman fall against the rotating wall, disappearing into the next room, leaving Henry behind.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: The Sinister Man, known for his sharp attire and impeccable manners as a member of the secretive organization working in the shadows of wartime Europe, clicks his heels and bows quickly. Brody, a scholar and archaeologist with a penchant for collecting rare antiquities, takes off his hat. The man turns and joins a Second Man, who is equally mysterious and part of the same clandestine circle. Brody and Sallah, a trusted Egyptian excavator and friend known for his bravery and loyalty, follow them. The Second Man overhears Sallah, who is known to be a bit too talkative at times. He and his companion turn quickly. Sallah puts Brody's luggage, which contains invaluable archaeological maps and artifacts, down and glances at Brody. Sallah pats his clothing, searching for his papers critical to their mission. Sallah laughs and pulls out a newspaper, cleverly using it as a ruse. Brody looks confused by this unexpected turn. Sallah shows the newspaper to the Second Man, distracting him. Sallah puts the newspaper in front of the Second Man's face, then punches him through the newspaper. Donovan, a wealthy industrialist with dubious allegiances, leads Vogel, a high-ranking officer notorious for his ruthless efficiency, out. The Nazi Guards, notorious for their unwavering loyalty and brutality, follow. Once they are gone, Elsa, a double agent playing both sides for her own gain, turns to Indy. She runs her hand down the side of his face, a gesture meant to both comfort and manipulate. Indy and Henry are still tied back-to-back, of course, captives in a perilous situation. Elsa bends to speak quietly into Indy's ear, which is near enough to Henry's ear, playing on their emotions. She smiles and kisses Indy passionately, a move that is as much an act of deception as of affection. Henry, Indy's father and an expert in medieval literature, glances back and looks rather disappointed by the display. Vogel appears to remind Elsa of her appointment, a meeting with high command that she can't afford to miss. Elsa exits, maintaining her calm demeanor. Vogel stays behind for another moment, ensuring Elsa's compliance and loyalty. Vogel punches Indy in the jaw, a hard and vicious jab that snaps Indy's head around, showcasing his brutality. Indy and Henry are pulling at the ropes with great urgency, desperate to escape. Henry is able to wiggle his hand towards Indy's coat pocket, where Indy often keeps tools of escape. Indy squirms his body around towards Henry's hand, coordinating their efforts. Henry's fingers open the lighter and ignite the flame, a small device that has saved Indy many times. Henry yelps as the cigarette lighter burns his hand, the pain unexpected. He drops the lighter to the floor, where it lands near a vulnerable spot. Henry kicks at the lighter, trying to reach it, but cannot. The rug, catching the flame, starts to burn, stoking the urgency of their escape plan. Finally, they turn their heads in the same direction, scanning for a solution. Indy struggles to free his hands, desperately seeking liberation. His foot kicks out and accidentally hits a metal grill that operates a Secret Door, ingeniously hidden within the architectural design, where a Nazi Radioman wearing headphones sits at an elaborate panel of dials, switches, and meters, vital for coordinating military operations, and a woman stands over a map plotting coordinates, crucial to their strategic plans. Their backs are turned to Indy and Henry, inside the fireplace, still tied back-to-back. Indy's foot hits the grill again, causing a mechanical sound. Four Nazi Radiomen and the woman are still hard at work with controls and coordinates, absorbed in their critical tasks. Suddenly the woman looks up and spots Henry and Indy, her scream piercing the tense silence. Indy finally breaks free, his resourcefulness paying off. All four Radiomen now have their guns drawn, their training kicking in. They activate the lever and begin to rotate through the Secret Door, a swift maneuver. The Radiomen appear in the fireplace on the other side, but there is no sign of Indy and Henry, their clever escape confounding them. The Radiomen move cautiously toward the flame, shielding their faces with one hand, holding their guns with the other, wary of any trap. They've hidden themselves up the chimney, using the old trick of concealment. And now they drop down, silently and strategically, behind the Radiomen. One of the Radiomen grabs Indy by the neck, a move meant to subdue quickly. As they struggle, they fall against the rotating wall and disappear into the next room, leaving a frightened Henry behind, who must now fend for himself.

In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Indy and Henry are pulling at the ropes with great urgency. Henry is able to wiggle his hand towards Indy's coat pocket. Indy squirms his body around towards Henry's hand. Henry's fingers open the lighter and ignite the flame. Henry yelps as the cigarette lighter burns his hand. He drops the lighter to the floor. Henry kicks at the lighter trying to reach it but cannot. The rug starts to burn. Finally they turn their heads in the same direction. Indy struggles to free his hands. His foot kicks out and accidentally hits a metal grill that operates a Secret Door where a Nazi Radioman wearing headphones sits at an elaborate panel of dials switches and meters and a woman stands over a map plotting coordinates. Their backs are turned to Indy and Henry inside the fireplace still tied backtoback. Indy's foot hits the grill again. Four Nazi Radiomen and the woman are still hard at work with controls and coordinates. Suddenly the woman looks up and spots Henry and Indy. She screams. Indy finally breaks free. All four Radiomen now have their guns drawn. They activate the lever and begin to rotate through the Secret Door. The Radiomen appear in the fireplace on the other side but there is no sign of Indy and Henry. The Radiomen move cautiously toward the flame shielding their faces with one hand holding their guns with the other. They have hidden themselves up the chimney. And now they drop down behind the Radiomen. One of the Radiomen grabs Indy by the neck. As they struggle they fall against the rotating wall and disappear into the next room leaving a frightened Henry behind.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: The Sinister Man clicks his heels and bows quickly. Brody takes off his hat. The man turns and joins a Second Man. Brody and Sallah follow them. The Second Man overhears Sallah. He and his companion turn quickly. Sallah puts Brody's luggage down and glances at Brody. Sallah pats his clothing searching for his papers. Sallah laughs and pulls out a newspaper. Brody looks confused. Sallah shows the newspaper to the Second Man. Sallah puts the newspaper in front of the Second Man's face then punches him through the newspaper. Donovan leads Vogel out. The Nazi Guards follow. Once they are gone Elsa turns to Indy. She runs her hand down the side of his face. Indy and Henry are still tied backtoback. of course. Elsa bends to speak quietly into Indy's ear which is near enough to Henry's ear. She smiles and kisses Indy passionately. Henry glances back and looks rather disappointed. Vogel appears to remind Elsa of her appointment. Elsa exits. Vogel stays behind for another moment. Vogel punches Indy in the jaw a hard and vicious jab that snaps Indy's head around. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The Mischievous Cat taps its paws and nods slowly. Jamie puts on her scarf. The cat spins and meets a Third Cat. Jamie and Alex trail behind them. The Third Cat notices Alex. It and its buddy spin abruptly. Alex sets Jamie's backpack down and peeks at Jamie. Alex pats her pockets, searching for her keys. Alex chuckles and pulls out a magazine. Jamie looks bewildered. Alex flashes the magazine to the Third Cat. Alex shoves the magazine in front of the Third Cat's face, then kicks it through the magazine. Morrison guides Turner away. The Robot Guards trail after them. After they vanish, Lydia turns to Leo. She traces her finger along the side of his arm. Leo and Max are still tangled side-by-side, naturally. Lydia leans to whisper softly into Leo's ear, conveniently close to Max's ear. She grins and hugs Leo warmly. Max peeks back and appears rather unsatisfied. Turner surfaces to remind Lydia of her schedule. Lydia departs. Turner lingers for another instant. Turner kicks Leo in the shin, a sharp and furious jab that spins Leo's body around. Leo and Max are yanking at the chains with great haste. Max manages to slide his foot toward Leo's coat pocket. Leo twists his torso around toward Max's foot. Max's toes pop open the matchbox and light the match. Max squeals as the matchbox singes his toes. He drops the matchbox to the ground. Max nudges at the matchbox, striving to reach it, but fails. The carpet begins to smolder. At last, they nod their heads in the same direction. Leo wrestles to liberate his arms. His knee jabs out and accidentally strikes a wooden panel that operates a Hidden Vent, where an Elf Operator wearing earmuffs sits at an intricate console of buttons, levers, and gauges, and a gentleman stands over a globe charting courses. Their backs are turned to Leo and Max, inside the bookshelf, still tangled side-by-side. Leo's knee strikes the panel again. Four Elf Operators and the gentleman remain busy with buttons and courses. Abruptly the gentleman glances up and notices Max and Leo. He shouts. Leo finally breaks loose. All four Operators now have their wands out. They pull the handle and commence to rotate through the Hidden Vent. The Operators emerge in the bookshelf on the opposite side, but there is no trace of Leo and Max. The Operators proceed cautiously toward the fire, shielding their eyes with one hand, clutching their wands with the other. They've concealed themselves up the flue. And now they leap down, behind the Operators. One of the Operators seizes Leo by the elbow. As they grapple, they crash against the revolving wall and vanish into the adjacent chamber, leaving a startled Max behind.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: The Sinister Man clicks his heels and bows, while Brody removes his hat. The man joins a Second Man, followed by Brody and Sallah. Overhearing Sallah, the men turn quickly. Sallah finds a newspaper instead of the papers and punches the Second Man through it. Meanwhile, Donovan and Vogel exit with Nazi Guards. Elsa approaches Indy, tied back-to-back with Henry, and kisses him. Vogel interrupts and punches Indy. Struggling, Indy and Henry manage to ignite a lighter, which Henry drops, setting the rug on fire. Indy accidentally activates a Secret Door revealing Nazi Radiomen and a woman working with dials and maps. The woman notices them, prompting the Radiomen to draw guns. The Secret Door rotates, but Indy and Henry are gone, having hidden up the chimney. They drop down behind the Radiomen, and in the ensuing struggle, Indy and a Radioman fall through the rotating wall, leaving Henry alone.
